I am a technical product manager by profession, but in past adventures have dabbled as computer vision researcher, FPGA product marketing engineer, and research software developer in a Music Cognition Laboratory, and more recently data science. I enjoy simplifying complexity into elegant product experiences.

Here're some data science or coding projects I've been working on.

Flight Delays

Delayed aircraft are estimated to have cost the airlines several billion dollars in additional expense, not to mention the uncertainty it adds to a passenger's travels. The goals of this project as part of the Metis week 2 & 3 project is to predict flight delay time using linear regression based on 2017 United States flights data. Through the analysis, it should also shine a light on factors that impact flight delay time, and help others to develop mitigating strategies.

See here for code on Github.
See here for blog post.

  • Team: flights
  • Date: January 2019
  • Category: ML

Movie Genre

We all love watching movies. It's helpful to use genre as a way to decide what movie to watch, without reading full movie descriptions. But it's not always easy to identify genre of a movie. Even if one is already identified, it may not be one you agree with. What if there's a way to identify genre using natural language processing, based on movie plot? Possible applications could be to predict genre when there is none available. Perhaps more common though, is to help identify alternative applicable genres even when there is one identified.

See here for code on Github.
See here for blog post.

  • Team: movies
  • Date: February 2019
  • Category: ML

Startups

As a potential investor or hire, how can you assess whether to further invest or join a startup? This project predicts type of status (acquisition, IPO, close, operating) for a company given current funding and company information. This can help potential investors or employees to look out factors to assess a startup and the potential exit path.

See here for code on Github.
See here for blog post.

  • Team: startups
  • Date: February 2019
  • Category: ML
